The "Glossary M-R" is a comprehensive reference guide detailing gambling-related terms that begin with the letters M through R. This glossary serves as an educational resource for individuals seeking to understand the terminology used within the gambling industry, particularly in the context of Australian gambling regulation and practices.

== Glossary Terms M-R ==

=== M ===
; Marker
: A line of credit extended by a casino to a player.

; Maximum Bet
: The highest amount of money that can be wagered on a single bet.

; Multi-line Slot
: A type of slot machine that allows players to bet on multiple paylines.

=== N ===
; Natural
: In card games, a hand that achieves the best possible outcome without the need for additional cards or actions.

; No Deposit Bonus
: A promotional offer by online casinos where players receive bonus funds without needing to make a deposit.

; Nut Hand
: The best possible hand in a poker game at any given moment.

=== O ===
; Odds
: The probability or likelihood of a particular outcome occurring in a gambling game.

; Offshore Gambling
: Gambling activities conducted through operators located outside the jurisdiction of the player's country.

; Overlay
: A situation in which the odds of a game favor the player rather than the house.

=== P ===
; Parlay
: A single bet that links together two or more individual wagers for a higher payout.

; Payline
: A line on a slot machine where a winning combination of symbols must appear for a payout.

; Progressive Jackpot
: A jackpot that increases each time the game is played but not won, often linked across multiple machines or games.

=== Q ===
; Quads
: In poker, a hand containing four cards of the same rank.

; Quota
: A specified amount or limit, often used in the context of betting limits or casino earnings.

=== R ===
; Rake
: A commission fee taken by the house from each pot in poker games.

; RNG (Random Number Generator)
: A computer algorithm used to ensure the random outcome of games.

; Roll Over
: The requirement to wager a certain amount of money before a player can withdraw bonus funds.
